data.title: Academic Book: Relations Between the Sexes in the Plays of George Bernard Shaw
data.meta_description: Examines the many heterosexual configurations in the plays and to demonstrate by the accumulation of evidence that the actions of Shawâ€™s chief characters are typically the result of their sexual concerns, often coupled with issues of principle. This book is a must for all Shaw specialists and will be of great interest to teachers and students of English and Continental drama and literature of the late nineteenth and early twentieth century.
